result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court  possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect. Court vacates GPS monitoring. Defendant to reside with Sahara M only unless any other address has been granted by the court.

Defendant Devajio D Thomas in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Devajio D Thomas in custody.  Kathryn Ginsberg on behalf of appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Cash Bond AMENDED from $40,000.00 to $1,000.00 cash bail. Court amends bail conditions. Previous request for speed trial demand withdrawn by the court. Defense to provide new address of defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 5/17/22 converted to bail hearing as requested by defense.
Expiration 8/10/22.
Filed: Defendant's Bail Review Motion.

Defendant Devajio D Thomas in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs; both appear by video.  Defendant Devajio D Thomas in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Buchman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WNW.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Devajio D Thomas in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
